abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental and social safeguards
            framework for the Morocco Basic Education Reform Support
            Program, which improves pre-school and primary education,
            improves instructional quality, builds institutional
            capacity, anticipates negative environmental and social
            impacts and suggests measures to mitigate them. Impacts
            arise from school building construction and operation and
            the land acquired. Issues and impacts include: soil and
            subsoil degradation, biodiversity interference, flooding,
            noise and air pollution, landscape changes, landslides,
            construction waste, hygiene, security, user accessibility,
            and accidents. Measures that will contribute to mitigating
            these effects comprise using fencing, installing
            surveillance, public awareness, local authority exerting
            control, and national oversight. More specifically, Road
            signs and markings will be issued as regulated, an
            operational manual will contain procedures to be followed,
            standards set under the National Education and Training
            Charter will be applied, and community responsibility and
            support for school buildings will enlisted through
            distributing a guide and providing local training.
